result.execSummary:
The defendant Virgil A Hansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Virgil A Hansen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Virgil A Hansen was found guilty of Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Virgil A Hansen was found guilty of Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).
  • Virgil A Hansen was found guilty of Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $1,315.83 fine to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond to be applied.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond to be applied.
Must complete a sexual deviancy evaluation & comply with treatment.

Not to have contact with anyone under the age of 18, the victim or his family.
Absolute Sobriety.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

supervisions.notes: May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.
Must register as a Sex Offender for life.

Jury Quest. Telephone conference with offices to prescreen jurors to not be called in due to conflicts.  Will call in remaining number.  seating 13.  each side 5 strikes. Atty Anderson, other instructions to be submitted 10/30/17.  Jurors can note take during trial only.  COC to provide ADA and Atty Anderson copies of questionnaires.  Bond Continues. 8:47 adj.
